nodes.bodyText: We should make a fluent API for the helm chart values
work on fluent API for operator, domain and update the PR?
Fluent api for domain... I'm willing to help with these :)

@@ -14,30 +21,225 @@
 
     // ----------------------   operator  ---------------------------------
 
+    /**
+     * Install WebLogic Kubernetes Operator
+     * @return true if the operator is successfully installed, false otherwise.
+     */
     public static boolean installOperator() {
         return Operator.install();
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Upgrade existing Operator release
+     * @param values map with values
+     * @return true if the operator is successfully upgraded, false otherwise.
+     */
+    public static boolean upgradeOperator(HashMap<String, String> values) {
+        return Operator.upgrade(values);
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Makes a REST call to the Operator to scale the domain.
+     * @param domainUID - domainUid of the domain
+     * @param clusterName - cluster in the domain to scale
+     * @param numOfServers - number of servers to scale upto.
+     * @return true on success, false otherwise
+     */
+    public static boolean scaleDomain(String domainUID, String clusterName, int numOfServers) {
+        return Operator.scaleDomain(domainUID, clusterName, numOfServers);
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Delete the Operator release
+     * @return true on success, false otherwise
+     */
+    public static boolean deleteOperator() { return Operator.delete(); }
+

+     * @param domainYAML

nodes.bodyText: Similarly, let's make the tests more expressive.
We have an API for standard types. io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1PersistentVolume
happy to discuss, but if it is ugly, i would prefer to have a fluent api that hides that ugliness under the covers
These types already provide a fluent API: https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java/blob/master/examples/src/main/java/io/kubernetes/client/examples/FluentExample.java
Test class will directly call the fluent api to create these or primitive class Kubernetes will use fluent api to create?

do we need the builder? i did a lot of googling and i did not come up with a definitive answer. this seems to be builder pattern, which is almost the same as fluent, but not exactly. i think fluent is more of a static that manages the instance. i don't mind really - i will defer to @rjeberhard and @ddsharpe on this

fluent example https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java/blob/master/examples/src/main/java/io/kubernetes/client/examples/FluentExample.java @rjeberhard suggested uses builder, thought we wanted to use that pattern. Not sure if he meant to use that only for Operator or Domain.
